p: The oleoresin essential oil of P. amazonicum demonstrated antifungal activity against C. albicans, C. neoformans, and A. niger. C. neoformans was most potently inhibited with a promising MIC of 156 μg/mL. Inhibition of C. albicans (MIC = 313 μg/mL) was also rather promising whereas inhibition of A. niger was relatively weak (MIC = 1250 μg/mL). The major component in P. amazonicum oil, δ-3-carene, has shown antifungal activity against several fungi, including C. albicans [ 47]. In addition, minor monoterpenoid components in the oil, α-pinene [ 48], limonene [ 49], and α-terpineol [ 50], have also shown antifungal activities.
